Echo-Friendly Description: Do your emotions feel intense, fast-shifting, or hard to control — like waves that crash in before you know what triggered them?
Do you often lose track of time — running late, forgetting appointments, or underestimating how long things take?
Do you sometimes act before you think — like blurting things out, spending impulsively, or taking risks you later regret?
Do you carry a deep feeling of being broken, unworthy, or not enough — even when no one else says so?
Do you often feel on edge — like you're scanning the room or waiting for something to go wrong?
Do you ever feel far away — like you’re watching yourself from outside, or the world feels unreal?
Do your moods shift in clear waves — days of low or high energy/emotion, often without clear triggers?
Do you get thoughts that come out of nowhere — disturbing, repetitive, or hard to stop thinking about?
Are you easily overwhelmed by sounds, lights, textures, or smells — like your senses are turned up too high?
Do you struggle to fall asleep, stay asleep, or feel rested — even when you're exhausted?
Do you feel driven to get everything 'just right' — like mistakes feel unbearable, or you avoid things you can’t do perfectly?
Do you feel deeply hurt or anxious when someone seems upset with you — even if they haven’t said anything?
Have you lost interest in things you used to enjoy — like hobbies, food, or even seeing people you care about?
Do you feel constantly drained — like you’re running on empty no matter how much rest you get?
Do you ever feel the urge to hurt yourself — not to end your life, but as a way to release emotional pain or feel something?
Do you often pull away from people — even if you feel lonely or wish you could connect more?

Symptom: Panic or Sudden Surges of Fear
Echo-Friendly Description: Do you sometimes get hit by sudden waves of panic or intense fear — even if you don’t know why?
Do you find yourself replaying conversations, decisions, or worries over and over — like your mind won’t let go?
Is it hard to begin tasks, even small ones — like there’s an invisible wall between intention and action?

Symptom: Feeling Out of Control Before Period (if applicable)
Echo-Friendly Description: Do you feel like your emotions or body become unmanageable before your period — like you become someone else for a week or two?
Do you feel terrified that people might leave you — even when there's no clear reason to think they will?
Do you often hide how you're feeling — putting on a calm or cheerful front even when you're struggling inside?
Do you feel crushed, ashamed, or panicked when you’re criticized — even gently?
Do you find yourself checking things over and over — like doors, stoves, or even memories or thoughts — just to feel safe?
Do you sometimes go emotionally blank — like your system just powers down or you stop feeling anything?
Do your thoughts bounce quickly — or is it hard to hold focus because your mind keeps racing somewhere else?
Do you ever feel physical sensations — like pain, nausea, or tightness — connected to past experiences or trauma?

Symptom: Need for Routine / Resistance to Change
Echo-Friendly Description: Do changes in routine or environment throw you off — like you rely on sameness to feel stable or safe?
Do you constantly scan how others are feeling — like you’re trying to predict what mood someone’s in or avoid upsetting them?

Symptom: Guilt for Small or Imagined Mistakes
Echo-Friendly Description: Do you find yourself feeling guilty over tiny things — or apologizing for things that aren't really your fault?
Have you ever felt like you didn’t want to be here — or caught yourself imagining escape, even if you wouldn’t act on it?
Is it hard to figure out where to start — like you see a pile of tasks and freeze, even if they’re all important?
Do crowded rooms, loud noises, or busy visuals overwhelm you — like your system can’t filter input?
Do your relationships swing between closeness and distance — like part of you craves connection, but another part pushes it away?
Do you ever have intense dreams or nightmares that seem linked to past experiences — even ones you haven’t thought about in years?
Do you ever feel afraid you’ll snap — yell, cry, break something, or lose control of yourself completely?
Do you go out of your way to keep others happy or avoid conflict — even if it means ignoring your own needs?
Do your feelings go from 0 to 100 quickly — like a small thing can set off a big wave of emotion before you can stop it?

Symptom: Feeling Like a Different Person Each Week
Echo-Friendly Description: Do you sometimes look back and feel like you were a different version of yourself just a few days ago?
Do you ever feel like you’re reliving something — emotionally or even with sights/sounds — as if it’s happening all over again?
Do you sometimes feel like your emotions are shut off — like you’re watching life from behind a glass wall?
Do you often imagine the worst possible outcome — even for small things, like a conversation or text?
Do you frequently seek reassurance from others — like you feel better only when someone confirms everything is okay?
Do you ever get disturbing thoughts that feel wrong or scary — like they’re not even yours?
Do you feel unsure about who you really are — like your values, beliefs, or personality change depending on who you're with?
Do you sometimes explode in anger out of nowhere — even over things that don't usually bother others?

Symptom: Fear of Being a Bad Person
Echo-Friendly Description: Do you ever worry that you might secretly be a bad person — even if you haven’t done anything wrong?
Do you often take on too much or say 'yes' when you want to say 'no' — because you feel guilty or afraid to disappoint?
Do you sometimes feel like any critique — even gentle — means someone doesn’t like you or thinks you’re awful?
Do you often feel like you’re a problem for other people — like your presence is too much or your needs are inconvenient?
